data.text: Drone Charging Sources for Bike Touring and Bike Travelling
I have a drone question. . What "charging source" do you use to charge your drone when on the road? I have a Mavic Pro and really do not want to commit to using wall outlets to charge my batteries.
Solar panel when I‚Äôm bike touring
data.author: Ty Dawley

data.text: Do you have the solar panel brand and model. I have bought 2 chinese but not so good...
data.author: Johnnie Walker

data.text: you need real monocrystalline panels
data.author: Clay Pardue

data.text:
we use 100w HQST panels for our house and they have been reliable. 20 watts should be plenty for bike touring https://hqsolarpower.com/20-watt-12-volt-monocrystalline-solar-panel/?gclid=Cj0KCQjwg_iTBhDrARIsAD3Ib5jt9gwSfY1oMOguygj7z7adJC2VmihzHVsZCXwDDIY9UgMw7cFlV1gaAgG_EALw_wcB
20 Watt 12 Volt Monocrystalline Solar Panel
hqsolarpower.com
data.author: Clay Pardue

data.text: The Pro is too big to take on a tour. Do you want your tour to be fun and stress free? Then just go without all the technology.
data.author: Javier Col√≥n

data.text: I use the mini 2 fly more combo - perfect and lightweight for travelling üôÇ you can charge everything off battery packs or from mains electricity. And the spare drone batteries can also be used as a backup power bank to charge your other devices if needed üòÅ
data.author: Alex Sidney

data.text: Monocrystalline solar panels are the most efficient by weight. 20 watts should be plenty
data.author: Clay Pardue

data.text: they have a metal frame it looks like? Why not get a small folding one like the ones Anker makes? They weigh like 1-2 pounds
data.author: Jeff Roe

data.text: Yah the one you linked is 5-6 pounds
data.author: Jeff Roe

data.text: You can install Dynamo hubs. Or use folding solar panels fixed on top of your luggage. Can find plenty options listed on line stores.
data.author: Mahesh T Pai
